text: of all the times that you saw the word

of all of those times how many times

various words based on how many times

the biggest problem in statistical
language modeling the fundamental
problem
is the zero problem there are many
things that happen
you might see my favorite yogurt in real

your 50 million words
and so if you're trying to infer what's
the probability of yogurt coming next
you might naively say

statistical language modeling is
figuring out how do you
predict things that really could happen
but you've never seen them happen before
so over the years statistical language
modeling
was dominated by this approach using
n-grams if you're using sequences of

and over the years as computers have
